org.sbml.jsbml.util

Interface TreeNodeChangeListener

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.EventListener, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SimpleTreeNodeChangeListener

    public interface TreeNodeChangeListener
extends java.beans.PropertyChangeListener
    A listener interface that allows applications to get notified if the state of any TreeNode object changes.
    Since:
    0.8
    Author:
    Andreas Dräger

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void nodeAdded(javax.swing.tree.TreeNode node)
      The TreeNode passed to this method has just been added to the a containing element.
      void nodeRemoved(TreeNodeRemovedEvent event)
      The TreeNodeRemovedEvent passed to this method provides information about the node that has been removed from a containing parent and does hence no longer belong to the SBMLDocument anymore.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.beans.PropertyChangeListener

        propertyChange

    • Method Detail

      • nodeAdded

        void nodeAdded(javax.swing.tree.TreeNode node)
        The TreeNode passed to this method has just been added to the a containing element.
        Parameters:
        node - This element is now part of the SBMLDocument.

      • nodeRemoved

        void nodeRemoved(TreeNodeRemovedEvent event)
        The TreeNodeRemovedEvent passed to this method provides information about the node that has been removed from a containing parent and does hence no longer belong to the SBMLDocument anymore. In addition, a pointer to its previous parent is also provided. In this way, an implementing class can identify the location within the tree where it was before.
        Parameters:
        event - The event containing information about the removed TreeNode.
